message.content: This question tests basic knowledge about the requirements for living organisms. Living things require a source of nutriment, or nutrients, to sustain their growth and metabolism. Option (A) is incorrect because living things require nutritious foods, not noxious foods that cause illness. Option (B) is incorrect because there is no mention of mutation or limbs being discussed. Option (C) is incorrect because while happiness may be important for some organisms, it is not a universal requirement for all living things.

This question requires understanding of the basic needs of living organisms. Living things require a source of nutriment, or nutrients, to fuel their metabolic processes and sustain life. Option (A) is incorrect because living things do not require noxious foods for illness. Option (B) is incorrect because energetic mutation of limbs is not a requirement for living organisms. Option (C) is incorrect because while some living things may experience happiness, it is not a universal requirement for all living organisms.

Option (C) is incorrect because while some living things may experience happiness, it is not a requirement for all living things.
